author: SAAMANYUDU

text: @Akshat you are just looking at the company financials but not looking at the business and how is the customers opinion. Bajaj finance is basically ripping off the lower middle class segment and capitalizing their inability. Overall, it's a terrible business with lot of customers dissatisfied. So from the business perspective, if they don't change the way they operate, the business is going to sink in the next 5-7 years with alternate lending platforms like P2P and other NBFCs providing better service. So just looking at the numbers is not fundamental analysis, you need to analyze the business. I have the same complaint with you on promoting NFTs, Gaming metaverses like crazy and later saying I'm not into gaming but people are playing. Don't live in Fantasy man - just for the sake of creating content and in the name of intellectual analysis, you are misleading the public.

text:
Hi Akshat, I noticed that Cash flows of the company has been negative for the past few years. For some years I found they have been financing/ repaying capital/liabilities which was responsible for the same but otherwise also cash flows have been negative. Typically we become skeptical when accruals vary greatly vis a vis cash flows. 

Could you throw some light on these aspects

author: Amadi Tempe

text:
Hello Akshat Ji,
I am of the view point that, one should both trade and invest at the same time in the market.

My query is- 
When thinking as an investor, I apply both technical and fundamental analysis instead of applying only fundamental analysis.
When thinking as a trader, the same happens again.
Switching between trader and investor mindset is confusing and difficult.

Plz share on how you manage between trader and investor mindset and how did you overcome this hurdle.
Also, do you use technical analysis for investing and fundamental analysis for trading.

How should I allocate my capital for trading vs. investing. I am thinking 50/50 would be a good mix.

Plz comment your thoughts on it and give me clarity.
Thanks in advance.
